document.heading: Boating While Intoxicated Temporary Act of 1996

history.narrative: Law 11-201, the “Boating While Intoxicated Temporary Act of 1996,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-804. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 3, 1996, and July 17, 1996, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 26, 1996, it was assigned Act. No. 11-364 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-201 became effective on April 9, 1997.
